alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Eastland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 12:35AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of far southeastern Eastland and northern Comanche Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1234 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near May, or 19 miles northwest of Comanche, moving east at 15 to 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... De Leon, Gorman, Rising Star, Proctor Lake, Comyn, Downing, Rucker, Beattie, Sipe Springs, Okra, Duster and Desdemona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
